patient_information: Age: 26 years Sex: female Residence: urban high-density area Occupation: businesswoman selling vegetables Family history: three healthy children, four toddlers died as toddlers Past medical history: unremarkable Travel history: recent travel to Malawi Allergy history: none reported
chief_complaint: Symptoms: headache of insidious onset and confusion for at least one week, unilateral ptosis noticed by relatives one day before presentation
history_of_present_illness: Onset: at least one week Symptoms: insidious headache, confusion for two days, unilateral ptosis noticed by relatives Progression: clinical deterioration leading to coma after a few days of treatment
exposure_and_epidemiology: Travel history: recent travel to Malawi Vector exposures: mosquito exposure implied by endemic setting Animal exposures: none reported Water food risks: none reported Contacts: no sick contacts reported Season outbreak context: unknown
vitals: Temperature: 38.4°C (101.1°F) Blood pressure: 115/75 mmHg Heart rate: 86 bpm Respiratory rate: 18 breaths per minute
physical_exam: {'general_appearance': 'seriously unwell', 'neurological_examination': 'Glasgow Coma Scale 14/15, no neck stiffness, clear chest, normal remainder of neurological examination', 'eye_exam': "left eye in a 'down and out' position"}
labs_and_diagnostics: Blood results: {"WBC": "3.2 × 10^9/L (4–10)", "Hb": "10.2 g/dL (12–14)", "platelets": "155 × 10^9/L (150–350)", "serum_glucose": "4.0 mmol/L (3.9–11.1)", "malaria_thick_film": "negative", "cryptococcal_antigen": "negative"} Csf results: {"opening_pressure": "markedly raised, 32 cmH₂O (12–20 cmH₂O)", "white_cell_count": "54 cells/μL (0–5)", "protein_concentration": "3.0 g/L (0.25–0.55)", "glucose_concentration": "1.3 mmol/L (<2.2 mmol/L)"}
differential_diagnosis: Considered: ["infectious meningitis", "tuberculous meningitis", "cryptococcal meningitis"] Reasons for consideration: ["clinical presentation with fever, headache, confusion, and cranial nerve palsy", "CSF findings of high protein and low glucose", "recent travel to Malawi"]
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment started: ceftriaxone 2g bid, fluconazole 1200mg od (local protocol for cryptococcal meningitis in the absence of amphotericin B and flucytosine) Response to treatment: patient slipped into coma after a few days Complications: bilateral basal ganglia infarctions on MRI scan Outcome: died in hospital
final_diagnosis: Diagnosis: tuberculous meningitis Confirmation method: positive CSF culture for Mycobacterium tuberculosis, positive HIV serology Evidence: ["clinical presentation with fever, headache, confusion, and cranial nerve palsy", "CSF findings of high protein and low glucose", "recent travel to Malawi"]
